lead_paragraph: AMES--Steven. The members of the Museum Council of the Herbert F. Johnson Museum of Art at Cornell University mourn the loss of its former Council Chair, friend, and devoted philanthropist, Steven Ames. Steven was an inspirational and dedicated leader, whose long service as a Council member culminated with an influential term as Chairman from 1996 to 2001. Steven's passion for the arts and collecting works of superb quality, coupled with his extraordinary generosity enabled the endowment of the Harriett Ames Charitable Trust Curator of Education; funds for educational programming, exhibitions, and artwork acquisitions; and numerous gifts of artwork that transformed the Museum's permanent collection. We extend sincere condolences to his loving wife Ann, children David and Marja Ames, Adam and Elissa Ames, David and Linna Sica, his grandchildren and extended family and friends with whom he shared his love for life and art. Chair Gary S. Davis, and former Council Chairs, Ira Drukier, Genevieve M. Tucker, Richard J. Schwartz; Stephanie Wiles, Director. 1/3
